reviews.text: This dated facility could use a refresh. Need to leave the game to get food, bathroom, and drinks. Design is specific to the era, so don't have high expectations. Its cozy inside for sure, not really comparable to the modern facilities you see everywhere else. But, it's the atmosphere that makes the venue, so best to go when the home team is on a winning streak, or when people are excited to be there. Otherwise, bring a book and catch up on your reading.

Although aging, I like the Saddledome. Got there when the doors opened so there was a crowd, but things moved along smoothly, even with the added security surrounding Barack Obama. He was the attraction when I attended. Coffee prices were very reasonable, but I can't speak for the rest of the concession items. Easy access by C-Train.

A seriously amazing experience watching the hockey game. The atmosphere is electric with tons of people cheering and the dome erupts after every point. A save? You'll hear cheers. A point scored against Calgary? There's still applause. It's the people that make it such a fun experience! You can actually feel the heat from the "fire cannons" after the flames score. The whole stadium is spectacularly red, from the lighting to the fan jerseys. A husky will fire out jerseys during the game too! How that dog got a firearm license is beyond me. The view from all sections gives you a decent view of the game so no need to worry about visibility (they also have huge TV screens for sections farther from the rink). 

Intermission means a flood of people heading to the washrooms so there is 100% a line for every single washroom. They have metal detectors before you enter the dome as well and you're not allowed to bring in food/drink. 

Food sold there is alright, beer, mac n cheese, fries, pretzels, your typical game food. They did have vegetarian options though. There's plenty of stalls strewn around the hallways with vendors walking up the stairway to sell directly at your seat. 

Some issues I have are with the hallways leading to the seats + the seats themselves. The Saddledome wasn't even fully filled and there were issues with getting out after the game. There's just so little room to move around that you're squished. Also getting to your seat in the middle of a row is seriously annoying. There's very little room to walk past other people so try to get tickets on the edge of the row. My tickets were 240$ for 2 people in section 2 but that can vary.  

It's definitely aging consider Calgary's population but it does the job. Space issues and the overall look is industrial. That said, you'll have a great time despite these small issues. It's a must go and the facility itself shouldn't stop you from relaxing and having a blast at the Saddledome! So much fun!

Amazing vibe, all the classic choice for food (actually decently priced!)

As a tourist & newcomer - id recommend getting the popcorn with butter! Download the Saddledome app for an EPIC experience.

I sat in my chair and for $1 extra you can have a whole food order delivered to your seat! Or even merchandise! (I got a jersey delivered as a souvenir.)

Amazing place to visit (see a game) !

Gotta love the 'Dome. A nostalgic building with high energy. If you want a great deal on wobblies and burgers/pizza before the game... Get down at least 30 minutes before puck drop and you'll get $5 dome beer and food. But be quick... The deal finishes exactly 30 minutes before puck drop!

I took my daughter and a friend to the zoo and I haven't been for years. I highly recommend a visit no matter what your age is.  My favourite animals to visit and watch were the pandas and the penguins!  They also have special events to attend which are posted on the website which make a great experience-based gift.

Fun place to go with family. The canteen has great food. Loved the fries. Lots of beautiful animals and friendly staff. I'd recommend this place, one of the best zoos I've been too. But needs options for lifts around the zoo if you dont feel like walking and maybe more shaded seating areas around the zoo, and drink locations. Other than that a great great zoo.

The pandas are my favourite part about the zoo. I have been to many others and the Calgary zoo is one of the best that takes care of its animals and executed proper maintenance for them as well. 

My niece and nephew are huge fans of the gorilla dug out, it’s good to see them out in the open down there! Will definitely visit again next year.

Love the attractions that they have. So worth season passes! As you get a great value for your money. The animals are very well kept. And the place is clean and well maintained. Highly educational to learn about animals in the wild and their habitat's. 
Recommend

Calgary's pride and joy, the Calgary Zoo is situated on an island (St. George's Island) in the Bow River, north of Calgary's historic Inglewood neighborhood, connected by the new Zoo Bridge (a good vantage point for photographers to get a shot of the downtown core with the Bow River in the foreground) and home of the new "Panda Pavilion". 
 
The Pandas arrived fromThe Toronto Zoo on March 23, 2018 for a five year tour.  The Calgary Zoo hasn't had pandas since the 1988 Winter Olympics. The 'Panda Pavilion' opened May 7, 2018 after the Pandas finished a 30 day quarantine. 

The Zoo, and the island it's situated on, were damaged during the flood a few years ago. The island has since been reinforced with a permeable retaining wall, designed to allow water flow while preventing future erosion. 

The Zoo is also home to "Zoo Lights", a Christmas Season tradition that is one of the more interesting Christmas Light extravaganzas in Southern Alberta.

The replacement pedestrian bridge at the Calgary Zoo has recently opened after the original had been destroyed by Calgary's flood a few years ago. 

The Zoo's own radio commercials say the best ticket prices are available on their website - so check it out first.  (The Zoo has adopted a "Disney" type priority booking system to view the Pandas where a specific time can be booked to minimize waiting in line to view them.)  The Zoo has also introduced 'enhanced packages' for special viewings and perks for members.  If you are from out-of-town, it may be worth looking into a membership to have these options to really WOW the kids if viewing the Pandas is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity for them. 
The Royal Canadian Mint has issued a 'Panda' silver coin ($30) to commemorate the five year visit of China's Pandas at the Calgary Zoo and symbolizing the increased tourism between Canada and China.  There is a rumor that one of the Pandas is pregnant. 

Enjoy your time at the Zoo and the Panda Passage.

A beautiful piece of local history. The facility is well kept and nicely organized. Everyone should visit to understand more of our heritage. There's aspects which appeal to both young and mature audiences. This is also a fantastic venue for corporate and personal events. The staff prepares excellent food options in a clean environment. Access should improve significantly upon completion of the 9th Avenue Bridge project.

Went with a school group. The presentations and activities were great. Very educational, refreshed my knowledge of early Canada and First Nations history. Was very hands on. Didn't see the usual museum part but what I saw was good

It's nice to see Calgary save a small piece of it's heritage. Nice spot for a picnic or rest stop while exploring the river valley. However compared to Fort Edmonton or Fort Langley it doesn't have as much to offer.
This place is so cool! I loved hearing about all our Fort Calgary history. I was lucky to go with my daughters school and was treated to the lessons from instructors.

Today enjoyed the Easter brunch at Fort Calgary,  It was beyond expectation, superlative and scrumptious.  The wait staff were very accommodating and patient but run off their feet.  They earned every dollar.   The brunch price includes a tour of the museum which is worthwhile visiting if you have time.  We must go soon to tour the museum as I love history.

This place is seriously fun.  We come here often for our little kid to play and it is fantastic.  Tonight I had the pleasure to attend one of their Adult Nights; I really recommend it.  An evening with a cocktail exploring fun science exhibits it a great Idea.  The 'grown up' experiments and information were well thought out; any age would have fun watching things be smashed while frozen from liquid nitrogen.  I am really looking forward to coming again.

This is an amazing place to visit with kids of any age! The outdoor area is incredible, the exhibits are always interesting and the food is delicious. I can’t recommend it enough! It is always worth getting a membership. Kids are free until three are 3. If you buy a membership just before they turn 3 they let you keep the free admission for the whole year. If you renew your membership early they give you two extra months free. They have tons of deals like this to make getting a membership worth it!! 

Currently they just opened the Circus Exhibit and it is amazing. It is so interactive and fun for all ages. Adults included. 

The food is really fresh and tasty. They pride themselves on getting ingredients locally and it shows. The prices are reasonable too!

This is our third year having a membership here. It's a great place for kids! Huge space for them to explore and play. The presentations they have in the theatre room and the main area are very engaging and interesting. Since they have the large outside play area we can also enjoy the outdoors when the weather is nice enough. The circus that they have right now is very fun and educational. I really like that the dome theatre is now included in memberships. It can get very busy so I try to not go at peak hours. Its definitely geared more towards kids. I don't think it would be very worthwhile for adults to go alone.

A great way to spend a day with an energetic and curious toddler. It was a warm day when we visited, so the outdoor park was open as well. My grandson had a blast stomping through the mud puddles, playing on the swings, and running back up the hill to slip down the slide again and again. 
His favourite indoor part was playing in the water area. The kid was soaked by the time we left, but that's not my worry! 
We packed our own lunch, the cafeteria has typical fare. They do offer veggie sticks and fresh fruit cups to. They were quite tasty, but a little pricey. 
We didn't see the whole place, as we let my grandson take charge that day and we followed where he wanted to go. More to discover next time!

So much fun!!! We went 3 times in a row and enjoyed it to the fullest. They have different themes it seems like a few times a year. Stations for all ages, and a cafeteria with restaurant style food. We had a pass but if you go without a pass it is very expensive which is the only down side.  The price is worth it if you go all day.
This park is closed for renovation. Scheduled to reopen Fall 2019

Was most definitely one of my favorite parks back in the day. Had a picnic and made many visits to this park frequently growing up. Now it's closed and under construction and being remodeled. So I'm looking forward to see what's done with it.

During the daytime it offers a beautiful green space with interesting fountains.  At night time it offers up a sense of adventure for those that like dealing with street crime.

My only problem is the guy playing chess. Just make your move already!
Stunning gardens, great place for picnics, photos and to enjoy beautiful days.
Getting a big reno this year can't wait to see the new park
Our family loves exploring the park. We always see some wild life & have a great time. Lots of picnic tables/fire pits & decent bathroom facilities.

Great place to on a nice day.  The paths are always clear (minus any natural events).  I have lived near fish creek for almost 10 years and have gone jogging, biking, and most recently, brought my daughter for walks here.  There is a but of construction going on right now with the addition of 2 man made ponds but other then that, great place to escape the city.  Would highly recommend if you are looking for a place to kill an afternoon.
Great place to go for a walk, options for paved or dirt trails. Good for bikes or walks we go there with our stroller and do a 6 Km loop and it's wonderful.
Amazing park in the middle of Calgary. Most people don't take advantage of what it offers. Hiking, bird watching, fishing, this place offers a getaway from life close to home.
Love it so much go to Fish Creek park at least two three times a week and never get bored as to how much it as to offer. Great mountain bike trails!

A visitor from California, I found myself at the Olympic Plaza in the process of walking around downtown.  Calgary is such a livable city, and this is one more adjunct to that idea.  I saw the Plaza in August, but the fountain people were playing in becomes an ice skating rink in the winter.  I have ice skates and will have to try that when I come back in January.  There's a public washroom.  Surrounding the large fountain square, there are tiered areas with tables and chairs with take-out restaurants nearby.  The whole area is very pretty and highly recommended for the visitor.  It is easy right off the CTrain, which is how I got there.  Also nearby are the bronze statues representing The Famous Five.  That group in 1927 sought to have women legally considered persons so that women could be appointed to the Senate.  A fundamental step in women's rights that are now taken for granted today.  You can Google "The Famous Five" to learn more, but come to the Olympic Plaza to see the statues in their honor.

A nice little plaza where many events are held throughout the year. Ice skating is available in the winter (skate rentals are available as well for a charge). In the summer it's turned into a waterpark of sorts. Other times it's used as a plaza for mini concerts or food markets.

Although it's old, it's quite a beautiful plaza and amphitheatre. Can see the '88 Olympic torch while skating on ice, and lounging in the sun with some delicious nearby eats! All around, great place. It's ashame its not connected to city hall plaza. Would make for a very beautiful entrance.
Olympic Plaza is gorgeous. We love spending a day downtown and just exploring and Olympic Plaza is always where we start.
It's a nice place for skating during the day/night until a certain time I guess. (Winter time) spring and summer it's a Great place for a Picnic.

Nice place to unwind and explore the plateau after getting some exercise to the top.  The ridges, trees and ponds are nice, great to fly a kite and overlook the city.  Once on top the sound of traffic almost disappears when you walk further in, and it's like you're suddenly not in the city anymore.  Good to spend a couple hours.  It's a large place, easy to get lost 👌

Lovely place to go for a stroll, take the dogs for a walk, have a picnic, or just take some pictures. It's a great view of the city and amazing during sunset. The only thing I'd say is take a look at the map when first entering so you can exit the same way you came in otherwise you'll find yourself at the complete other end of the park at a different entrance.

Really nice place to go for a walk, truly representative of the prairies landscape. Trails on every direction and very safe. There is a parking lot, with limited spots, but I have never had a problem finding one. Off leash park, so bring the pupper!

Nose Hill, as all Calgarians know, is a great place for walks, watch the sun setting over the mountains and   going for long walks.  Lots of dogs off leash but that is fine.  The paths are both gravel and paved.  Excellent spot.

Nose Hill park is a great place to go for whatever reason. Whether you want to take your dog for a walk, take your date, go for a bike ride, it's always a good time. Lots of great trails to use and an easy way to escape the city without going to national parks like Banff.

The Christmas market is a must see. So many vendors and lots of things to do. We always stop in for a free family picture from Telus. Unfortunately, they don't have the band display anymore.... I can understand vendors may be annoyed by it constantly going, but it was a nice touch in the past. Would be nice if some new vendors were added to the mix, along with with new products and more food options.

Good holiday light show in the city. It's free, not at all crowded in my experiences, and you can walk and drive through the display. Definitely worth checking out before dropping $100 for a family at Zoo Lights.

We went to Spruce Meadows Christmas market and it was great. Lots of cool things to see and buy. It is very well organised and a great place to buy handmade unique items. 

I think 12 dollars is a bit much for entry but it is an entertaining day. It can get quite busy but the people directing traffic do an amazing job to make parking easy and safe.

Attended the 2018 International Christmas Market. There were 40 new vendors this year. The food is always good. The decorations are great. We have made this a family outing every year. We will come back every year for sure.
I love horses me and my boyfriend come here. To watch the Tournaments show jumping  every year in June it was amazing
Friendly staff, nice food. We had a banquet for 7 people with a pile of beers. Loads of well prepared, tasty food and reasonably priced as well.
Really nice surroundings lovely friendly staff and great food.  Brilliant value for money.  Well worth a visit.
Fantastic food and friendly service. Only place that has good aromatic crispy duck. They make some great food.
Would give zero stars if possible. Food was terrible, and the service was even worse! Avoid like the plague.
Remember that You have to pay extra money for rice. Beef was... lets say "good" and the service really nice.
Not exactly a park - more of a green space with concrete walking/cycling path running through. Was much better before the "improvement" when paths were asphalt & closer to the river.

The park is super clean and nice. A biking trail on one side and the river on the other. Very quiet compared to other parks in the area. Being adjacent to the river makes it very calming. There is a vending machine onsite, too.
Ventured to Stampede with family this year.  Went to Kids day, very efficient and organized.  Ride tickets were discounted, kids had fun.  Crowds were not too crazy.
Great park, often use stairs for cardio
Nice park close to downtown and stampede grounds for walking, jogging or biking

Nice place to unwind and explore the plateau after getting some exercise to the top.  The ridges, trees and ponds are nice, great to fly a kite and overlook the city.  Once on top the sound of traffic almost disappears when you walk further in, and it's like you're suddenly not in the city anymore.  Good to spend a couple hours.  It's a large place, easy to get lost 👌

Lovely place to go for a stroll, take the dogs for a walk, have a picnic, or just take some pictures. It's a great view of the city and amazing during sunset. The only thing I'd say is take a look at the map when first entering so you can exit the same way you came in otherwise you'll find yourself at the complete other end of the park at a different entrance.

Really nice place to go for a walk, truly representative of the prairies landscape. Trails on every direction and very safe. There is a parking lot, with limited spots, but I have never had a problem finding one. Off leash park, so bring the pupper!

Nose Hill, as all Calgarians know, is a great place for walks, watch the sun setting over the mountains and   going for long walks.  Lots of dogs off leash but that is fine.  The paths are both gravel and paved.  Excellent spot.

Nose Hill park is a great place to go for whatever reason. Whether you want to take your dog for a walk, take your date, go for a bike ride, it's always a good time. Lots of great trails to use and an easy way to escape the city without going to national parks like Banff.

I love going to Scotsman's Hill to grab photos of the skyline or to relax and take in the view! It's a beautiful area and is a "hidden" asset in Calgary.

There's usually not many people on the Hill and there's lots of parking on the side of the road. Also, there's a set of stairs (~6 minute walk down) to reach the pathways by the river.
Gorgeous. What's not to love. The most romantic place in Calgary!! Can't wait for warm summer days to chill here with my cuties.
Great view. Great for running up and down stairs

Great view of the Calgary skyline! It's in a neighbourhood so there's no actual parking lot but there's plenty of street parking available around! There's a lot of benches as well which provides a tranquil view to watch and look at the City of Calgary!
Amazing views of the city and mountains! Great place to watch weather coming into town!

Used to love going to this park but I've had more bad experiences than good. Pet owners let their dogs run around without keeping an eye on them; even when they're hurting other dogs. Not many owners pick up after their dogs, and they really don't know how to control their dogs. People are okay, but often rude.
They filmed the 1993 movie Cool Runnings along the river bank. What more could you want.
Awesome place to take your dog, lots of other friendly dogs to socialize with and nice views of the city and river.

Beautiful park with such a great view of the city. Great off leash park with river access. It does get busy but manageable. Keep in mind it is NOT fully fenced in for your more mischievous fur friends.
Very well-kept park. Everything seems to be clean and well-maintained. A bit muddy in places, but that's more the season than the city. Great place to take your dog for off-leash play

This dated facility could use a refresh. Need to leave the game to get food, bathroom, and drinks. Design is specific to the era, so don't have high expectations. Its cozy inside for sure, not really comparable to the modern facilities you see everywhere else. But, it's the atmosphere that makes the venue, so best to go when the home team is on a winning streak, or when people are excited to be there. Otherwise, bring a book and catch up on your reading.

Although aging, I like the Saddledome. Got there when the doors opened so there was a crowd, but things moved along smoothly, even with the added security surrounding Barack Obama. He was the attraction when I attended. Coffee prices were very reasonable, but I can't speak for the rest of the concession items. Easy access by C-Train.

A seriously amazing experience watching the hockey game. The atmosphere is electric with tons of people cheering and the dome erupts after every point. A save? You'll hear cheers. A point scored against Calgary? There's still applause. It's the people that make it such a fun experience! You can actually feel the heat from the "fire cannons" after the flames score. The whole stadium is spectacularly red, from the lighting to the fan jerseys. A husky will fire out jerseys during the game too! How that dog got a firearm license is beyond me. The view from all sections gives you a decent view of the game so no need to worry about visibility (they also have huge TV screens for sections farther from the rink). 

Intermission means a flood of people heading to the washrooms so there is 100% a line for every single washroom. They have metal detectors before you enter the dome as well and you're not allowed to bring in food/drink. 

Food sold there is alright, beer, mac n cheese, fries, pretzels, your typical game food. They did have vegetarian options though. There's plenty of stalls strewn around the hallways with vendors walking up the stairway to sell directly at your seat. 

Some issues I have are with the hallways leading to the seats + the seats themselves. The Saddledome wasn't even fully filled and there were issues with getting out after the game. There's just so little room to move around that you're squished. Also getting to your seat in the middle of a row is seriously annoying. There's very little room to walk past other people so try to get tickets on the edge of the row. My tickets were 240$ for 2 people in section 2 but that can vary.  

It's definitely aging consider Calgary's population but it does the job. Space issues and the overall look is industrial. That said, you'll have a great time despite these small issues. It's a must go and the facility itself shouldn't stop you from relaxing and having a blast at the Saddledome! So much fun!

Amazing vibe, all the classic choice for food (actually decently priced!)

As a tourist & newcomer - id recommend getting the popcorn with butter! Download the Saddledome app for an EPIC experience.

I sat in my chair and for $1 extra you can have a whole food order delivered to your seat! Or even merchandise! (I got a jersey delivered as a souvenir.)

Amazing place to visit (see a game) !

Gotta love the 'Dome. A nostalgic building with high energy. If you want a great deal on wobblies and burgers/pizza before the game... Get down at least 30 minutes before puck drop and you'll get $5 dome beer and food. But be quick... The deal finishes exactly 30 minutes before puck drop!

I seriously love this place. Good atmosphere great food. Awesome customer service. 

I'm so glad they decided to open a second location and its just as awesome as the first. Food came out quickly the staff was amazingly helpful. Would recommend to everyone.

This place is so cute , i love the layout and how trendy it is. The fact that the burgers don't cost much is my favorite part , the quality you get is great. They have arcade games set up as well tons of options to custom your burger i recommend bringing your family here or even for a fun date night. Parking is a bit tricky sometimes but they have small area in the back and the side.

I would highly recommend Boogie's Burgers to anyone who hasn't already eaten at this location,  or the Edmonton Trail location. They have really great burgers, including a great selection of varieties. There really is something for everyone on the menu. The onion rings are great and they have spicy fries of you're into that! I would HIGHLY recommend the milkshakes as well (especially the coconut).

It was good. The milk shakes were great and I’d imagine their more complex burgers are more tastier. I just had the regular burger with bacon and cheese. It was good, but not great. Nothing wrong with it at all, but it just didn’t stand out. Fries were great, service was fast, correct. Bill came to 42 bucks with 20% tip (two adults) 2 burgers,2 fries, 2 shakes. I think that’s fair. Has arcade games and a pinball game for the kids. It was a full place when we got there 1-1:30pm on a Saturday.

First timer at Boogies.  Got some burgers fries and a shake for take-out. Friendly people, made to order and very reasonable wait time. Shake was delicious and hand made with care and artistry. Great portion sizes and really good prices. Ironic vintage hipster joint, much enjoyed. Will return

It's good for what you need. An alternative to the regular downtown fair. But there falal is hard and to dry.

It's a shame because the used to be so good when the owner worked there.
Great Falafels. Always Fresh. Absolutely recommend this!
Falafel was so nice. I love the food and the great customer service there is amazing 👏😊
Good options for lunch and here we will get tasty grilled chicken with hummus.
Great lunch spot, super quick service and pretty delicious food.  Options for any falafel lover!

A great big hunk of quality beef between a nicely toasted bun. This place is simple, but what they do, they do extremely well. Excellent thick cut fries, and great dipping and/or burger sauces on hand from the adjacent farmers market. Quick service and friendly staff. This is a truly unique and excellent burger joint.

Rocky's has easily become my favorite burger place in Calgary! I don't know how they do it, but the burgers are thick and perfectly cooked every single time! Service is phenominal and incredibly friendly! Highly recommended to anyone craving a thick (over an inch thick) juicy burger! Everytime I go I leave full and satisfied

Can you get good burgers elsewhere in Calgary? Yes, of course you can! BUT, can you get the BEST burger in Calgary, and where would that be??? 
Wonder no more, Rocky's Burger Bus is THE place! 
Huge homemade patties, properly cooked throughout, cut on site fresh french fries and you get the picture! The burgers are so good they beg comparison to In N Out Burger, but these are in a totally DIFFERENT league! Yes In N Out is great, but when you want a FULL burger where the meat dominates, this is the ONLY place. Jim, his wife and son will ensure you enjoy a delicious meal. And I hope they never expand, I want to keep this burger secret to ourselves in Calgary! Go try it and if you agree, "like" my review. You won't be disappointed!
As good as the burgers are, and they're fantastic, the service of this family run business is even better. Thanks guys!
Handmade burgers and fries... wicked milk shakes! Outdoor burger bus serves up deliciousness.

If you want to play pinball and eat amazing hot dogs this is the place to go. They have vegetarian hot dogs ("not dogs") that you can substitute with and they have delicious creative hot dog toppings. I recommend the cheetah not dog.

The service was good and the place has a pretty funky vibe. Sadly I found the hotdog to be underwhelming.

I won't write the place off just yet -- maybe I just got unlucky.

Great hot dogs had A-bomb just awesome cool place to sit and chat with friends ...brings childhood memories ..

Thanks guys

Please make this place more popular. These are the best hot dogs in town with a great atmosphere and great service. There is no place like this in Calgary and should be treated as such. Make tubby dog busy again.
Service is great and THE FOOD! Atmosphere is absolutely killer :)

Nostalgic, cool little diner! Extremely friendly staff, excellent classic diner eats. Great breakfast joint!
There are only 5 tables and a bar top that seats a decent amount. A wait is common, but totally worth it and they have great waiting area infront of the restaurant outside.

YOU CAN GET HALF-SIZES!!!  The breakfast was very good (eggs benny on a croissant! Good hash browns) , but also, you can get pretty much everything in a half size, which is awesome for those of us who love brunch but can't finish the huge portions you usually get at diners. It is great, I approve.
Had the french toast. Classic diner flavour. Great atmosphere. Great place for coffee with friends or sneaky breakfast with family.

Great place to go for breakfast! Food is local and tasty.

If you show up after 8:30 AM on a weekend, you should probably expect to wait. Their waiting area is outside, but they do offer complimentary coffee while you wait.

This is a legit classic diner which was a pleasant surprise. It's small inside so you may have to wait but they have a nice waiting area out front. The pancakes were amazing! The waffles were pretty good as well. The Chuck Norris hash has some kick to it when you add the sauce and it's so good! The Montreal smoked meat was really flavourful here and they add nice portions of meat to each dish. Service was alright but I'd come back to try more of the menu.

My friend recommended this restaurant, and I just visited. 

But, I did not expect the  flavor of cilantro overwhelmingly. Honestly, it was too much for the first time visitor. 

After that, the chef told me, if you notice me that requests the lack of cilantro before the order the regular menu then I could give the less cilantro salsa, and others. 

And he gave me one bag of the chips. 

I am sure that recommend this restaurant for Mexican food, but if you are the first time visitor, you should tell them that they down the level of cilantro or other spices.
Amazing tacos their salsa was amazing. If you get spicy..  they mean it so be careful if you're not used to it!

I work in Kensington and this is one of two places I'll eat at weekly. The burrito is a wicked value. Chicken, beef or pork burrito always are good. Super nice staff. Possibly the best Mexican food in Calgary.
Excellent service, excellent food! The prices were great. Check this place out!

I was muy impressed, awesome service, Great food, awesome portion, Wow, Wow, Wow. This small Restaurant has very big character, I have given only 5 stars here but if I could give more I would. They deserve more that is how good the Food and Customer Service is. Very Well Done Bodega, very well done.

We had a lovely lunch. Really liked the atmosphere and the service was very good. The food was fantastic. I really enjoyed my mushroom burger and ginger bubble tea. I opted for the pita instead of the ciabatta bun for my burger. It was very yummy and light.Neither of us are vegetarians but we would do lunch there again.

The food here is always great. They cater to a wide variety of dietary requirements while still offering incredibly tasty food. It's well decorated and a nice place for a meal. The prices are good, the drinks are great and the food is worth the trip out! Definitely go here.

Great food and cool atmosphere... Definitely interesting.  Good drink selection as well though they are a little bit pricey.  The portions are large and the food is worth every penny.  A great choice for those who want a healthier option as well

Love this place! Very warm and welcoming feeling. Food was absolutely delicious and very vegetarian/vegan friendly. Very accommodating and friendly service. Love that there’s a place so environmentally conscious. Menu was a little on the expensive side. They do provide discounts if you bring in your own take out containers!

Been here a few times now and the food has never disappointed us. It's nice to have amazing food options when you want to take a break from eating meat. The servers are incredibly friendly and knowledgeable in their menus as well!
Fun atmosphere. Great food and beer. Kelly (who tended bar) was awesome. And 5 stars to my fellow lunch mates at the bar too. I’ll definitely be back and I recommend this place as well! Thumbs up!!!

Great atmosphere. Usually pretty busy, but with a good crowd. It's like the place you want to go with your friends to relax and have a good time.
Can't say anything bad about any food I've had there, it's always been good and tasty. 
You won't wait long for drink either. Usually more than one person will stop by to make sure you've got what you need, without being intrusive. Great service with a smile.
Check the website for more. They have different activities during the week: live music, trivia, etc

The James Joyce Irish Pub and Eatery was excellent! We went for lunch. Brian our waiter was on point from the second we walked in and sat down. Welcomed us asked if it was our first time being there and was very helpful explaining their rewards program. The Food was exceptional I had the mighty Irish burger and fries and my girl had the bangers n mash. Both were excellent choices along with the Brie appetizer. Black and Tan beers and Two Henry’s hard pineapple cider beer. We’ll definitely be back again. Thanks Brian!

Great establishment all the way around. Service, drinks, atmosphere and the location were all great. The drinks were generous. I loved their front patio area, very nice place to  watch the rest of the surrounding areas of downtown. Also, parking is very convenient!

I’ve been here about three or four times in the last month. Very nice place to catch a game. The food is incredible. I cannot overstate the quality of the food, it’s unbelievably good for the expectation of most dive bar food.

Excellent show at Lolita's.  Carly's angels are amazing. Haven't laughed this hard in years. Our server was on his second night, and he did an outstanding job keeping our group of 4 happy with food and drinks.  We will be back. If I could give 10 stars i would.

Great space and our waitress was very accommodating. We saw a jazz band (Redline Trio) and they came down to chat with the patrons after their performance. Also, there was lots of information about upcoming jazz events, too.
Very cozy intimate music place!! A small place. Best for going there with your date or bunch of girlfriends to celebrate birthdays!!
The band was phenomenal and the bottle of Malbec wine that we ordered was nice. The menu was too limited though. Also, the decoration didn't seem to have received enough attention.

Over priced drinks and meals (for what you get), under sized drinks for what you pay. I wouldn't recommend the $8.00 margartia. The calamari appetizer came out luke warm. Enchiladas were $19, came out hot but i wouldnt order it again.  Eat elsewhere if your coming for a show. Washrooms do not have working hot water just cold running water. hopefully the kitchen does have hot water!!

Been here a few times, always have great food here. Went there tonight and it packed. Great to see! There slow days are usually Monday and Tuesday but it was a full house almost. I can't pick one item I like here, all of it is delicious. Must try for Indian food.
The Moti Mahal served a lovely lunch... the restaurant has a nice decor and the staff was friendly and efficient without being overbearing. I look forward to my next visit there.

Favorite Indian restaurant in YYC. The owner is super nice, his kids work there and the business has been in the family since 1982. We ate there again on Valentine's day and our 2 small kids had a blast on the swing greeting guests. The copper dishes are a hit and the food is remarkable. They really put a lot of effort into their ingredients and methods and it shows! Best eggplant of any Indian restaurant.

Always great service and great food! And they definitely know how to accommodate as I have a friend who is celiac and they always make sure we have food that is not contaminated for her and they are always full of recommendations.

Cheers for an awesome meal every time!
Met up for a girls night this week. The service was execellent. The sever helped me choose the best dish. Butter chicken was unreal! Everything was so delicious and made with care. Best experience!
We had a lovely vegan lunch here. Portion sizes were plentiful and tasted very fresh. The owner is lovely and we enjoyed our meal. Will definitely be back.

The food here was exquisite, every dish was to die for. All the employees were very friendly, and they served the food promptly and professional . I extremely  recommend  the mango creme brûlée. Everything on the menu was equally delicious. I will be back here again!
Dumplings were tasty, but our entrées lacked flavour & spice. Overall, food was ok, but not exciting. NOTE: @orchidroomyyc is closing & their last day of service will be Sept 7/18. (3/5)

Our group of three's entrees were mediocre, flavorless and overpriced - but they did come out quickly. Perhaps it was our mistake ordering Vietnamese dishes here? I must say the dumplings we started with were delicious but something like $12 for six. It was very busy in there, so I'm not sure if other menu items are what they are popular for, but we won't likely go back to try. Our reservation made online through Yelp wasn't in their books either.
Absolutely delicious food! Quick and friendly service. I just wish they would deliver so I could get it at night!!

Fantastic steaks and top notch service.  My first visit at Caesar's was in the 80's.  The ambience has not changed much over the years- just love their interior.  It is one of the few restaurants where their primary focus is still on the quality of the food and service.

Absolutely delicious steak - expensive but not unreasonable, as the meal includes a salad, delicious cheese and/or garlic bread, and a cup of French onion soup. Delicious steak and overall very good meal. Service is also always fast and courteous.
Great ambiance and customer service! Price is reasonable and servings are filling! Props to Ben, from London, for being an awesome server! He was attentive and friendly!

Mixed review on this one. Service was excellent and top notch for their caliber. However food is just not as good as other steakhouses. My steak came undercooked both times I've been there. The taste is also not distinct enough to separate them vs competitors. Will not be returning because of this.

This is a really unique place, the interior has a fascinating design. I don't want this to be seen as a negative, but I got some weird Twin Peaks or Stanley Kubrick vibes while here, which frankly made my visit all the better! Had some great drinks and good food.

Charcut is an excellent place for lunch or dinner. The food was great and there was lots of people there so probably best to make a reservation. It is a fancy yet casual vibe which is great for a business lunch. The standard lunch menu items are always great and come out in record breaking time without sacrificing any quality. I will definitely be going there again!

While staying at Hotel Le Germain, we checked out Charcut, a modern steakhouse that boosts farm-to-table cuisine. I particularly enjoyed the duck fat poutine which comes highly recommended. However, while I always order my steak medium rare, the meat was slightly on the rare side and came too drenched with sauce for my liking. Service was excellent.

While we had valet parking courtesy of the hotel, I imagine street parking would be tricky to find.
Always good for lunch or dinner. The positive reviews are accurate. Great quality food, seasonal dishes, well prepared, with excellent service. Recommend reservations on weekends.

Came here for a business lunch. I recommend reservations as it does fill up quickly.
Great place. Food was amazing, service was excellent. The chef came around to check on meals periodically. Very impressive overall. Picture is of my tea - cast iron!

Food is consistently of high quality with very good service. Lunch can be quite hectic and rarely, very slow (however in this single instance we were compensated very fairly by the manager). A reservation is a must, as well as a coffee after your meal because portions are above average. In this regard, Charcut overall is of incredible value and highly recommended.

Always passed it, but never tried it. Went with a some friends on a Saturday night. Valet Parking was prompt and professional. Went inside, and was greeted by friendly hostess that walked me through the lounge where there was a bluesy jazz group playing. Great atmosphere. 

Had the duck ravioli appy, 12oz rib eye main and then a cappuccino to end. Service was exceptional and food was always presented by the runners. The waitress was excellent and helpful. Best service I've had anywhere. 

Definitely a great first experience. Will go back again. Thanks Rush!

Went to this restaurant on a Friday night and the service was remarkable. From the minute we pulled up our car was taken care of complimentary. Walked in the door and our coats were taken immediately and seated directly after. Then we were approached in a friendly manner for our menu and drink orders. Throughout our meal we had exceptional service. If we finished a drink, a different waiter/waitress would come from across the room to top us up even if we weren't in their seating area. I think in total we had 4 or 5 different people approach us and we never once had to ask for anything to be brought to us. Food was spectacular and the portions were huge and definitely worth the price! We'll be dropping by Rush more often!

I saw the positive reviews for this restaurant so I thought I would try it out and was glad that I did. The staff were very polite and attentive. I had the duck which was cooked perfectly and was full of flavour. It was a wonderful choice.

Our table was served by I can only describe as the worst customer service I have ever received. Our waitress, a blond Australian girl, initially took our order, then all night was nowhere to be seen. Adjacent tables also were not getting any service by her as well. Occasionally she would pop out of the back, but walk right past us. We had to call over another waitress and order food and drinks from her all night. It was the worst customer service I've ever experienced. However, the food was actually quite good. It's too bad the kitchen and other staff have suffer a bad review due to this waitress.

I love a great restaurant and it is seldom that I will give a bad review based on one experience.  This is that exception.  

Meal was dreadful!  My order of Wagyu Beef Tartare was so full of gristle that it made me gag.  I really love this dish when prepared properly.  I returned it to the kitchen, only to be told that this was something they sold a lot of and was very popular.  (um  ok...interesting but irrelevant!) That is unfortunate as people clearly do not know how delicious this dish can be. The way that the manager dealt with my complaint was really distasteful.  Very rude and I left wondering why he bothered to even ask me about it as he certainly wasn't interested in any feedback.  Wine list is lackluster, the restaurant is clearly taking advantage of their great real estate and don't care to provide a good to great dining experience.  Won't go back and certainly won't recommend it

I recently visited the Saltlik together with my son. We were looking for nice steaks. And we found them there. Very yummy, cooked to perfection. And the service was great as well. I would give 5 stars if they would not have had that strange DJ who played that awful music.

We had a fantastic, unexpected experience at Saltlik. We got here at 9pm when happy hour was starting, and the prices/menu for happy hour was so good! We sat downstairs in the lounge.  I had the steak sandwich, was perfect!  Good drinks at a great price. 
Would defenitly recommend and go back for sure!

We sat at the bar downstairs which was lively but not too loud.  The young bartender was very friendly, nice to chat with, and provided great service.  Good selection of beers at a decent price.  we had the nachos, which I would give a solid 5 out of 10, ya, not very good.  The chips they use were really good but they put very little cheese or toppings on top and they cover it with a pretty spicy hot sauce, rather than on the side, which could be a little overwhelming for the less spicy taste buds.

This is an amazing steakhouse. I was with a group and the service was great; our waiter, Winchester, took awesome care of us and made suggestions for ordering our steaks and pairing them with wine. The food was delicious. We had a wonderful time treating ourselves and will definitely be back.

Hanger steak at the bar is incredible. Tip to the manager: don't let you staff sit at the bar and get drunk when they're not working. It's a turnoff and I had to relocate due to noise after the 7pm tequila shots came out.

Our first course and dessert were delicious.  Our main dish was okay. Wasn't our favorite but also wasnt bad. We both found our main dishes a bit on the saltier side. But we still finished everything. Service was okay. Overall good food and would come back.

Blink Restaurant and Bar is a great restaurant to visit from beginning to end. The quality of service provided by our waiter was top notch and the flavor found in eclectic drinks was worth every penney. Every single meal from appetizer to main entree was delicious with great portion sizes. The restaurant is centrally located in St. Stephens Avenue, making it really worth visiting. I would recommend for a special ocassion or event.

Blink Restaurant and Bar is a great restaurant to visit from beginning to end. The quality of service provided by our waiter was top notch and the flavor found in eclectic drinks was worth every penney. Every single meal from appetizer to main entree was delicious with great portion sizes. The restaurant is centrally located in St. Stephens Avenue, making it really worth visiting. I would recommend for a special ocassion or event.

Not impressed won't be back. Me and a friend went on a Saturday night. The restaurant was less then half full. Our server was very unwelcoming and on several occasions just ignored that we had spoken to him at all. We ordered the ravioli for and appetizer and it was tasteless. My friend ordered the pickerel and it was just bad. I ordered the duck and was given the beef. No one seemed to care at all about the mistake. And getting my proper meal took far to long all while my friends food got cold. Once I got the duck it was very good. We paid the full (over charged) price for what was a half terrible meal. I've had much better for much less and where servers gave a damn about what they were doing.

Wish there was an extra half star to rate with. Not quite a 4 but it's better than what I consider a 3 star. Empty upon arrival but waiter seemed to be suppressing a very heavy cold, so not a great welcome. Nice seating and atmosphere. Pricey: short ribs same price as Calgary tower restaurant, but a smaller portion and tasted dry. He said it was a new --just that night---menu item and thanks for feedback, the chef could use our comments to improve the dish..but shouldn't the chef already know how 40$ (small portion) short ribs should be cooked? Great taste makes smaller portion acceptable. Tortellini forgettable. I was prepared for cost as my daughter lives far away now, so of course wanted a memorable evening out experience. Blink has a nice and relaxing atmosphere, and good menu items. Maybe it was just an off night for them. Some changes and it could be really amazing establishment. I feel bad, we had a great time together but it was because we were together, not because of the food.

I would HIGHLY recommend this place! The food is amazing, the service is excellent, and it has a nice atmosphere. It also has its own dedicated parking, which was a great bonus. I had the lamb and also added shrimp. I can easily say that was the best lamb I’ve had in ages! It was juicy tender and full of flavour. The bruschetta was also top notch. There isn’t a single thing I would change. I only wish I had heard of this place sooner. Can’t wait to go back!

This is the best place I have ever been to I got definitely recommened to other people because the food quality is amazing the staff are nice and i would defenitly recomened  if you have lot of money but if you dont want to pay 300$ then go to edo or somewhere cheaper. because my whole meal was 1200trillion dolaars including the tip of 99%. i love this place i have gone there lot and love the service the waiters are good looking and thats what i like:)

One of my favorite places in the city for Authentic Italian food.   The owner Michael is an extraordinary host that makes every guest feel like at home with his charming personality and outstanding service.   It's a must go to place for a romantic night or even a business meeting. The ambiance is great for any occasion.  Hands down the best risotto in calgary  and one of the few resturants that has parking aswell so next time you are in Kensington drop by for a light lunch or a relaxing authentic Italian dinner experience at a price everyone can afford.  A must try restaurant in Calgary.
I got a pile of GREY  slop served in pools of grease, GREASE GREASE GREASE. Only good if you are rich, and snobby.

Michele is a wonderful host and we eat there regularly.  Large parties, small parties, business lunch/ dinner or an intimiate night out Osteria caters to everyone.  Great food Great service Great atmosphere.

If you have never been here you need to get here. The best food and drink. A lot of fun watching the chef cook on the grille in front of you. Chefs and staff add to the experience with humor and great service.
Love Japanese Village. Its an awesome experience every time I go. The food is amazing the staff is fantastic. They always make me laugh. Its great fun! 😊

Really nice place. The lighting helps set the mood for a meal. The chefs are funny and interactive with the guests. Food was excellent and was cooked to my request. The prices are reasonable for what you are getting. If your on the mood for Japanese, you need to hit this place up.

We went there for a birthday party and it was excellent.  It was easy to park across the street in the Parkade, the wait was short (had a reservation), the food was excellent with the chef asking about any food allergies, and the chef was also extremely entertaining. I would highly recommend this restaurant for any special occasion or really anytime.
Great first time experience. The chef was hilarious, I expected to pay a lot but was really worth it. You pretty much pay for dinner and a show

Wow!! Absolutely amazing food. Business dress. Our waitress, Gabby, was great and very accommodating. She made you feel welcome. Even though the price was in the higher range, yet reasonable for the quality of service and quality of the food.

The menu is not extensive, but somehow covers a wide range of possibilities, something for everyone, even if not much for vegetarians. The wine list is not extensive but is well chosen. The food is excellent quality -- good ingredients, correctly prepared, very tasty. The server was very friendly and knowledgeable about the food and also the wines and beers.

This restaurant is an exception to the ones that you would fine in comparision to the others in the neighbourhood, its the only fine dining restaurant around.Upon entering your greeted by the pleasant staff and directly in front of you is a large open kitchen behind the bar. A large rotisserie containing BBQ chickens, Prime Roasts and an array of different activities occurring with a wood oven in the kitchen in full view. It was great. Our service was Connor he was attentive to our needs, the food was outstanding and had a very lovely evening. One we look forward to again.
By far the best restaurant meal I have had in a long time. The service was great, and the wines paired nicely with the menu.  Ask the bartender Kelsey for his specialty cocktail.  Delicious!
It was just great, as usual. The lamb sirloin was amazing and very tender. As a famous man once said, "I'll be back".
The River Cafe always makes for a beautiful night out and great spot for a date. I highly recommend the Chef's tasting menu! Buy the ticket and take the ride, you won't be disappointed ;)

This place is the a key to a successful romantic night out, surrounded by a park hidden in downtown close to a cinema. It greats the perfect vibe for a great night out plus the food is amazing and the drinks are served fast! Thank you for a great time!

One of the best....as a frequent visitor to Calgary, I have tried pretty much all the higher end restaurants downtown. You can't beat RC for the excellent ambiance, food and location. It is a converted concession stand, but you would never know it. It is very nicely finished inside...I've had the duck, chicken and a few beer entrees and have thoroughly enjoyed each one. I stay at the Sheraton and it is a 5 minute walk down the Bow. Do yourself a favor and dine here.

There are just a few places that we will always recommend and "The RIVER CAFE" is highest on a short list, in fact it's OUR number one. They have the freshest LOCALY supplied ingredients and the ambience is second to none! When open we try to go there for all our special occasions, or just because, try to make a reservation especially in the warmer months, this is not a secrete place others have this HIGH on there MUST EAT HERE list.

Amazing food!! Never anything short of a perfect experience. We have done both a tasting menu with wine pairing and just ordered off menu as we pleased, both are great options. My only criticism would be our server did not really know the wines she was serving, she read the label and didn't give much information on the reason for the pairing. But still great none the less

Definitely make a reservation during the holidays and special dates (valentines & mother days). Food is alright wouldn’t say it’s he best considering you’re paying a pretty penny. If you dine here you get access to the Calgary tower which is a perk. Desserts are heavy alcohol based. Also wouldn’t recommend this place is you have children unless they can sit in their chair during dinner.

A friend and I stopped here for brunch before going to a play. I don't usually like hash browns but these were delicious and the eggs were perfect. Past meals have been delicious and I look forward to many future meals.

My boyfriend made reservations for my birthday. Atmosphere and view were amazing. Nice experience, but won’t go there for the food! At $62 a person for the chef feature , we were highly disappointed. My steak tasted like charcoal and gas. No flavour ... also the cheese cake crust was burnt, not sure if they had a new cook on last night or one who obviously didn’t care. Go for the view but there’s plenty of other places to go in Calgary for good food!

This review is a LONG time coming. I have to admit I was a little nervous about booking Sky 360 for New Years. Like so many venues geared towards tourists, I expected it to be all about the view and less about the food and service... Could not have been the furthest thing from the truth!! Yes, even at night the view was incredible. Especially with all the Christmas lights around the city and beyond. But the food was perfectly prepared and every staff member we interacted with had a smile and was genuinely happy to be helping in any way they could to make our evening a special one, and they truly did. We will be back! If not before, definitely to see in 2020.
Beautiful restaurant with a cozy feeling. It's simply beautiful and the view is breathtaking. I can't describe and the food is absolutely delicious.

For Thanksgiving our family ordered the cooked Turkey, stuffing and gravy.  It was all fantastic.  As much as we ate (15 people) there was plenty stuffing and gravy left over, which was great for sandwiches etc., for a couple of days and the Turkey was spectacular.  Beautifully browned skin and moist as can be.  I decided to buy a turkey for Christmas and cook it myself.  I didn't brine it, but it didn't need to be.  Once again it was moist and and oh so flavourful.  I am not surprised because I have had nothing but excellent service and products from there for many years.  The staff is friendly but most of all, knowledgeable.

The best meat shop in town. Services is excellent, staffs are friendly and helpful and always have smile on their face. The quality of meat is the best of the best. They even vacuum pack the meat if you request. I drive 40 minutes from where I live to the shop but it worth. You can't buy same quality of meat in the big box store. This is  why I keep going back to buy meat from them.

This place is outstanding. I appreciate knowing I can buy local and responsibly raised. The staff knows their stuff--having watched them french trim a rack of lamb or two in front of me! The ability to customize meat preparation specific to a recipe is pretty sweet, too.

Bon Ton is super consistent. I've never been disappointed with a cut of meat. The fact that you can get anything cut anyway you'd like is really convenient.  I often ask for them to shave the rib eye for when I make Philly cheese steak,  honestly it comes out see through thin.   Both there savoury and sweet pies are among some of my favourite in the city.  There's no doubt that it's very pricey, but sometimes you have to take a hit in cost for great quality.    Come check this place out, you won't be disappointed with the service and professionalism.
Takes me an hour there and back but it's worth it, great butcher with very knowledgeable people. Always have to leave with a hot steak pie.

Kids size dipped cones used to be like $0.25. I'm pretty sure last year they were a dollar 25. Now they're basically 2.50. I get that knew owners probably had to pay millions for this place and now just need to earn a return on their capital, but I'm going to spend $3 next time and get Village, Fiasco, or Marcus.  Much better quality and great taste too.

No options even remotely healthy so don't expect any junk alternatives.

This place has a cult following..it can be seen through the flock of people dining around n long lines n lines for the cars for pick ups..

That's where it all stops....

Milkshakes were a treat n definitely worth it..great flavors. We had coffee, marshmallow n Oreo.. definitely coming by this joint for..

Burgers we're a disappointment..patties were not seasoned n were not juicy n very dry...no cheese on them even when we asked...they were soggy with the Peter's sauce..

Hot dogs were better n the accompaniments definitely made it good to eat.

Fries were undercooked n oily!!! When it's nit cooked through right it's oily...

Onion rings were much better n was full of flavors n crunchy.

Will definitely go for milkshakes n NOT for burgers..

Staff was very friendly n helpful.

Food-1
Drinks-4
Service-4

To quote my girl Oprah "you get 5 stars, and you get 5 stars, everybody gets 5 stars!" Cause legit this place is the best. I've never actually eaten here simply cause I'm lactose intolerant but weak willed and milkshakes are my Achilles heel so i try to avoid it, HOWEVER this place gets five stars cause I have a right hand drive car and y'all have a drive through on both sides of the building for me to use! Bless your hearts and busy business! 😘

I love Peters' milkshakes! They're super thick and delicious. My favorite is either blackberry/blueberry + strawberry + banana. The fries and burgers are old-school, and delicious also. Oh and don't order the family size fries unless you (and like 12 of your best friends) are starving. It's massive!

I have eaten here twice, the first time was so bad that I could physically squeeze grease from the saturated onion rings.  The burger was nothing but a puck of flavored rubbery filler and I had to stop after 3 bites to avoid throwing up.  I dumped this into the garbage and chalked it up to a "one off" bad experience.

A few months later I decided to give Peter's another try.  This time I took my adult son along and both of us had to dispose of the garbage they tried to feed us.  

It totally blows my mind how anyone can call this substandard stuff "food".  It's glaringly obvious that the lineups are merely derived out of convenience of location being situated on 16 Avenue.  These are mostly impulse decisions by unsuspecting drive-by travelers who are seeking a quick hunger fix.  All of the good burger places worth visiting are not located on the trans Canada and therefore out of reach for folks passing through the city.

There are several top notch burger places very close to this place which would serve you far better.  You can search google for them and I would highly suggest it.

Not recommended!

Bumpys is the best. I make it my regular comfort food spot, when I need a little hug from the inside. 

Today when I went, I did get missed during the lunch rush, BUT, when I voiced that my food hadn't come, the girls quickly fixed the situation and I had my warm gooey mac and cheese within moments! We are all human, we make mistakes. But it's how we deal with those mistakes that depict true quality. 

Bumpy's is just that, true quality. 

Also, get the mac and cheese. 10/10 recommend.
Kind staff, patient too. Has a very nice cafe atmosphere and the food is good. Tried the Vietnamese latte and loved it
Place was small and tight. Latte wasn't great but the muffin was good.
They have amazing mac&cheese. They make the best tasting london fogs I have ever had. If you haven't tried their chocolate chip walnut muffin, YOU'RE MISSING OUT!
Great local coffee shop, baked goods are unique and fresh (often still warm), quiche is perfect for an early morning.

Great coffee in an accessible location. Stopped by here with a co-worker to check it out and was extremely happy with the quality of the coffee and the friendliness of the staff. It's a very clean, almost stark, coffee shop that feels coldly fashionable but retains a welcoming feel. Easy to access from the C-Train which is a big plus. Will definitely come back for more.

Honestly, the BEST coffee I've ever had. Just ordered an Americano from Deville Coffee and it was the smoothest cup of coffee I've ever drank. I take my coffee without sugar or dairy, so I am always in search of genuinely delicious coffee. Deville hit the spot! Great atmosphere and friendly staff too.

One of the cosiest and delicious coffee places in Calgary.  Forget the chain, plan your meetings and visits at Deville.  The food and treats are as awesome as the friendly smiles provided by the staff.  Just be mindful of the time because you won’t want to leave.

Was walking Stephen Avenue with the family and stopped in here for coffee. I would definitely recommend. The people that worked there were nice and it was clean and surprisingly spacious inside. My vanilla latte was delicious. I added some cinnamon to it which made it all the more delicious.

In the past I would have given Deville a 5 star rating but unfortunately the new Swiss coffee machines don't make as good coffee as the old Italian ones. I always order a dry cappuccino but the foaming capability of the new machine is quite poor and it now ends up as a latte. I have stopped going to Deville for this reason alone.

This is the perfect spot to grab a coffee if you’re strolling along the Bow river in downtown Calgary and need a quick coffee. There’s an abundance of seating available in a very chic corner of P&B, which shares a space with Charbar. The line can get long, but it moves fast. 

They always have a seasonal drink on hand which is a treat! The quality of the coffee is superb, one of the best local spots in Calgary.

Nice spot in a historical building, atmosphere is relaxing and I trust that they can make good coffee and related beverages, but I must say that 3 out of 5 times I was really disappointed. I’ve tried many of their creations and either the macchiatos are sour/acidic, which is unpleasant, or the London Fog has no vanilla syrup in it. Those are the little things that contribute to making it a little less exceptional than it should be.
Great coffee spot. If you can't find a place to sit, be sure to check upstairs. Coffee is great and the baking is even better. Over our multiple visits we have tried nearly everything. It's all good!

Nice little coffee shop along the pathway system on the east end of Downtown. Coffee is good but they have limited options for children or non-coffee drinkers AND there isn't much indoor seating available if you're looking for a place to warmup and visit before continuing with your walk etc. Service is friendly and reasonably quick which is nice as well!

A bit out of the way but it's great to have good coffee in an area of the city that used to be a coffee wasteland. Expect to have a few people in line when you arrive. Service isn't incredibly fast but, in my experience, they are friendly and the coffee is consistently good. I find their espresso a bit on the tart side but not so much as to make me pucker. Great building with history and beautiful brick walls. Seating for about 30 at tables of 6. Could get up to 8 at a table for a meeting.

A nice piece of history of the oil industry in Turner Valley. Only one building is open for viewing as of this time. But many plans in the future to develop the site more. The guide is well knowledgeable and friendly. Saw some deers while walking there too. Its about an hour long tour. The tour comes up by schedule and only opens on Summer weekends so plan accordingly.

Very historic part of Alberta with very good interpretive centre. All Albertans should try ti visit Turner Valley to learn about the origins and foundation of our resources industry. Plant has been decommissioned but still a producing gas field.
Being the first commercial gas plant in Alberta, it is a historic site of great importance. It is also a good place to learn how gas is sweetened.

I really enjoyed my tour.  The guide was well informed and took the time to get to everyone’s questions.  If you live near or around the plant, it’s worth going on the tour.  Everyone from Calgary looking for a fun day trip... this is it. Lost a star due to the visitor Center not having much in the way of artifacts.  Most of the buildings are shuttered up so it would have been interesting to have more of the stuff they used in the plants on display. HINT: see the original spot where the oil rig at heritage park used to stand (or a reproduction of it is at the park )

reviews.author_name: Pedro Luiz de Souza Pinto Filho
reviews.text: Nice history place abou the oil field
